title: Stock Futures Waver, Bond Yields Rise Ahead of Jobs Report
sub_head: Yield on 10-year Treasury notes rises above 1.6% for first time since June
body:
U.S. stock futures wobbled and bond yields rose ahead of fresh data on job growth that is expected to provide insight into the recovery of the labor market and economy.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 slipped 0.1%, after rising for three straight trading sessions and closing up 0.8% Thursday. Nasdaq-100 futures also edged down 0.1%, pointing to a muted decline in technology stocks after the previous dayâ€™s rally.
